DOC.detailed_description: BACKGROUND : The study test hypothesis motivational intervention would yield great reduction smoking-related index , compare usual care comparison condition . The study also predict motivational intervention would differentially impact cognitive behavioral mediate mechanisms accelerate behavior change maintenance . Finally , study test hypothesis motivational intervention would yield great reduction household exposure environmental tobacco smoke ( ETS ) , therefore would also result significantly reduce number child 's respiratory illness . DESIGN NARRATIVE : This study utilize community health center serve low SES population Rhode Island . The population approximately 40 percent Hispanic 45 percent Caucasian . Subjects randomize two intervention condition : ( 1 ) motivational intervention , utilized self-help , telephone counselor call , motivational interviewing provide feedback child 's health status household concentration nicotine ; ( 2 ) usual care , include provision self-help material . A repeated measure design use ( baseline , 3- 6-month follow-up ) . Outcome measure include household nicotine concentration , movement stage readiness change , smoke cessation attempt , point-prevalence abstinence rate , child 's health status . Several important public health priority research lung health prevention target study , include : ( 1 ) reduction ETS exposure among child low income family , group particularly high prevalence chronic ETS exposure ; .
